Key Match Events: N'Golo Kanté's pass led to Randal Kolo Muani bundling the ball in off Jan Vertonghen's leg, securing a 1-0 win for France.
France scored a late own goal five minutes from time to win the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Kevin De Bruyne called a reporter's question about his side's golden generation'stupid'.
Post-Match Reflections: France coach Didier Deschamps expressed satisfaction despite the narrow win, stating they enjoyed possession and had more opportunities.
Randal Kolo Muani attributed his goal to luck and bringing energy and speed to the game.
Belgium's Kevin De Bruyne's side limped into the knockout stage with an unimpressive performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at Merkur Spiel-Arena in Düsseldorf, Germany.
France has not scored from open play so far in the tournament, recording two own goals and a Kylian Mbappé penalty.
Belgium managed only two goals in three group-stage games.
